turn.text: No, Your Honor, we have no quarrel with the armies decision to use these buildings and we have no quarrel with the army's decision not to effectively defend them, they just knocked the fire --

turn.speaker: earl_warren
turn.label: Chief Justice Earl Warren
turn.text: Well, I think you do because you claim they were doing it for a purpose other than to defend the area and defend the people in it.

turn.speaker: ronald_a_jacks
turn.label: Mr. Ronald A. Jacks
turn.text: No, I'm sorry if I have created a misimpression Mr. Chief Justice.
I -- we contend that the army seized the buildings for as Mr. Justice Black indicated for the defense of the entire zone.
And it was a prudent decision to withdraw in there but our point is when our buildings are seized and used for a Governmental purpose, the Government as a whole should pay.

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: (Inaudible)

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: Were there any other --

turn.speaker: ronald_a_jacks
turn.label: Mr. Ronald A. Jacks
turn.text: Excuse me, I --

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: (Inaudible) in your mind if the army hadn't shown up, these buildings would still been blown up?

turn.speaker: ronald_a_jacks
turn.label: Mr. Ronald A. Jacks
turn.text: Yes, there is Mr. Chief -- yes, sir.

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: (Inaudible)

turn.speaker: ronald_a_jacks
turn.label: Mr. Ronald A. Jacks
turn.text: I think again it's the causal relationship between the buildings that the Army were in and the armies were not when read as a whole.

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: (Inaudible) when the army arrived,(Inaudible)

turn.speaker: ronald_a_jacks
turn.label: Mr. Ronald A. Jacks
turn.text: There was a small -- may I, Mr. Chief Justice?

turn.speaker: earl_warren
turn.label: Chief Justice Earl Warren
turn.text: Yes, yes, of course.

turn.speaker: ronald_a_jacks
turn.label: Mr. Ronald A. Jacks
turn.text: There was a small fire in the YMCA alone and that was quickly extinguished and that's no part of the total lost by the army.

turn.speaker: earl_warren
turn.label: Chief Justice Earl Warren
turn.text: What would have happened if the army hadn't put it out with the rioters in there?

turn.speaker: ronald_a_jacks
turn.label: Mr. Ronald A. Jacks
turn.text: If the army hadn't cleared that building?

turn.speaker: earl_warren
turn.label: Chief Justice Earl Warren
turn.text: Yes, I may hadn't have gone in there to use -- to defend themselves.
What would have happened to that building if they haven't gone in there and done that?

turn.speaker: ronald_a_jacks
turn.label: Mr. Ronald A. Jacks
turn.text: I don't know Mr. Chief Justice except that was not the portion of the YMCA that was destroyed because it was a different, it was a brick construction primarily whereas the portion that was destroyed was wooden.
So it's not clear that the building would necessarily have been lost.

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: Were any other building was destroyed like this?

turn.speaker: ronald_a_jacks
turn.label: Mr. Ronald A. Jacks
turn.text: Were any other buildings destroyed?

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: Yeah.

turn.speaker: ronald_a_jacks
turn.label: Mr. Ronald A. Jacks
turn.text: Yes, the buildings by the hash marks, the YMCA, the Masonic Temple and the old commissary building which is here owned by the Government and the sequence of the mob was first at this then at the Masonic Temple and then later at this.

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: And no troops in the commissary building?

turn.speaker: ronald_a_jacks
turn.label: Mr. Ronald A. Jacks
turn.text: Yes, there were troops in the commissary building.

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: Were there troops in the sanitation building?

turn.speaker: ronald_a_jacks
turn.label: Mr. Ronald A. Jacks
turn.text: That -- record's unclear on that and I do yield to the Solicitor General in pointing out that was burned and I'm not so sure whether troops surrendered or not.

turn.speaker: potter_stewart
turn.label: Justice Potter Stewart
turn.text: Suppose they're not -- those are government buildings, are they?

turn.speaker: ronald_a_jacks
turn.label: Mr. Ronald A. Jacks
turn.text: Yes, yes, I refer the Court to our appendix in our brief where we show on page 220, Exhibit E10 on the back of the appendix.
Mr. Chief Justice, may I just --

turn.speaker: potter_stewart
turn.label: Justice Potter Stewart
turn.text: Yup, yes.
You're alright to answer.

turn.speaker: ronald_a_jacks
turn.label: Mr. Ronald A. Jacks
turn.text: E10 on page 228, the building, the tall building on the left is the Masonic Temple and the observation point was on top of it and the building on the right is the YMCA and as you can see of to the right the damaged portion of it.
This was taken shortly after the destruction of YMCA.

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: That's a picture, E10?

turn.speaker: ronald_a_jacks
turn.label: Mr. Ronald A. Jacks
turn.text: Yes, Mr. Chief Justice, E10 and E on the preceding page 219 shows -- those are pictures of the troops inside the YMCA before they were driven out by the fire.

turn.speaker: earl_warren
turn.label: Chief Justice Earl Warren
turn.text: Very well.

turn.speaker: ronald_a_jacks
turn.label: Mr. Ronald A. Jacks
turn.text: Thank you Mr. Chief Justice.

turn.speaker: earl_warren
turn.label: Chief Justice Earl Warren
turn.text: What in -- our general nature was done -- was the damage to this building, to either of them?

turn.speaker: ronald_a_jacks
turn.label: Mr. Ronald A. Jacks
turn.text: The YMCA lost a total wing which was in the nature of an auditorium which is primarily of a wood construction.
The main building where the initial fire was Mr. Justice Marshall was not substantially destroyed.

It was the wing to the YMCA that was lost and the Masonic Temple, it was a second and third floor fire damage and interior but the Masonic Temple was made of brick and mortar constructions so it really didn't go despite continues efforts to set it to fire.

turn.speaker: earl_warren
turn.label: Chief Justice Earl Warren
turn.text: Was that from the Molotov cocktail?

turn.speaker: ronald_a_jacks
turn.label: Mr. Ronald A. Jacks
turn.text: Yes, being -- the records clear on that, being thrown in to the second floor over a prolonged period of time.

turn.speaker: earl_warren
turn.label: Chief Justice Earl Warren
turn.text: I see.

turn.speaker: ronald_a_jacks
turn.label: Mr. Ronald A. Jacks
turn.text: Thank you.
